summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's daily lieutenant's log for August 9-10, 2019, documenting routine operations and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and transported to a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019, triggering a medical emergency response and CPR.

persons.name: Lieutenant G.
persons.context: Assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant at 12:00 AM on August 10, 2019, and was later relieved at approximately 5:30 AM.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Special Housing (Dry Cell)
events.description: At 3:58 PM, an inmate (context suggests Epstein) was transferred to special housing (dry cell).

events.title: Epstein Transferred to Psych Observation
events.description: At 7:24 PM, an inmate was transferred to special housing (psych observation). The log notes multiple inmates on psych observation/suicide watch with inmate companions throughout the day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein at the scene and continued by EMTs during ambulance transport to a local hospital.
The log indicates Epstein was on 'psych observation' with an 'inmate companion' and was also placed in a 'dry cell' under staff watch in the days/hours leading up to the incident.
The document records routine correctional center operations, including counts, equipment checks, and system statuses (e.g., fire alarm system inoperable, PA system malfunctioning).
The log shows a shift change and transfer of duty between lieutenants around the time Epstein was found.
